top_note: This estimate represents a complete and accurate assessment of costs required to restore the roof system to pre-loss condition in compliance with all applicable building codes and industry standards.
bottom_note:
This estimate includes all items necessary for a complete roof replacement compliant with:
- International Residential Code (IRC) 2021 Edition - Adopted by Virginia
- OSHA Safety Standards 29 CFR 1926 - Fall protection requirements
-Virginia Uniform Statewide Building Code (VUSBC)

Special Considerations:
1) Mansard Roof Complexity - Requires specialized installation techniques and additional safety measures
2) Manual Debris Handling - Site constraints prevent direct dumpster access, necessitating hand-carry operations
3) Gutter Integration - Existing gutters installed beneath shingles require complete replacement for proper installation
4) Multiple Dormers - Complex flashing details and tie-ins increase installation time and material requirements
disclaimer: All pricing reflects current 2025 market conditions in the DMV area with appropriate regional cost adjustments.

items.name: Fall Protection Equipment & Setup
items.dec: OSHA 29 CFR 1926.501 compliance for work above 6 feet on 6/12 pitch roof. Safety harness systems and guardrail protection required

items.name: Property Protection & Tarping
items.dec: Protective coverings for landscaping HVAC units and adjacent structures. IRC requirements to prevent property damage during installation

items.name: Site Setup & Material Staging
items.dec: Establish safe work zones and material staging areas per IRC R905.1 compliance for proper installation access and workflow

items.name: Remove Existing 3-Tab Shingles
items.dec: Complete removal of existing 3-tab roofing material to deck. Required for proper substrate inspection per IRC R905.2.1

items.name: Remove Existing Gutters & Downspouts
items.dec: Removal necessary as gutters improperly installed beneath shingles prevent code-compliant installation of new roofing system

items.name: Manual Debris Handling Surcharge
items.dec: Hand-carry debris due to inaccessible dumpster placement. Additional labor required for safe material transport from roof to staging area

items.name: Roof Deck Re-nailing
items.dec: IRC R803.2.1 requires proper fastening. Re-secure loose sheathing with 8d ring shank nails at 6 inches on center for code compliance

items.name: Deck Inspection & Minor Repairs
items.dec: Inspect sheathing for damage and replace compromised areas. Code requires structurally sound substrate before new installation

items.name: 3-Tab Shingles (25-Year)
items.dec: Standard 3-tab shingles with 10% waste factor applied. IRC R905.2.4 compliant installation maintaining like-kind replacement standard

items.name: Ice & Water Shield
items.dec: Applied to eaves valleys and penetrations. IRC R905.2.3.2 mandates ice barrier protection in Virginia climate zone

items.name: Ridge Vent - Aluminum
items.dec: Replace existing aluminum ridge vent system. IRC R806.2 requires continuous ridge ventilation per exact measurement

items.name: Mansard Installation Complexity Premium
items.dec: Additional labor premium for mansard roof installation requiring specialized techniques safety measures and extended installation time

items.name: Dormer Installation Complexity Premium
items.dec: Premium for complex dormer integration work requiring specialized flashing details and precise tie-in procedures

items.name: Step Flashing - Complete System
items.dec: Wall-to-roof step flashing per Roofr measurement 87 feet 9 inches. IRC R905.2.8.3 mandates minimum 4-inch headlap

items.name: Valley Flashing - Closed Cut
items.dec: IRC R905.2.8.2 valley waterproofing with closed-cut installation method per exact Roofr measurement of 19 linear feet

items.name: Wall Flashing
items.dec: Counter-flashing at wall penetrations per IRC R905.2.8.4 requirements. Measurement matches Roofr specification exactly

items.name: Chimney Flashing Complete
items.dec: Complete small chimney reflashing with cricket and counter-flashing. IRC R905.2.9 penetration waterproofing compliance

items.name: 5-inch K-Style Gutters
items.dec: Heavy-gauge aluminum gutters properly secured beneath drip edge for code-compliant water management system

items.name: 3x4 Downspouts
items.dec: Aluminum downspouts with proper slope and drainage connections to existing drainage system

items.name: Downspout Extensions
items.dec: Proper water discharge extensions directing water away from foundation per IRC R801.3 drainage requirements

items.name: Soffit Ventilation Inspection
items.dec: Ensure adequate intake ventilation per IRC R806.2 requirements. Verify 1:150 net free area ratio for proper attic airflow

items.name: Single-Day Coordination Premium
items.dec: Specialized project coordination for compressed timeline ensuring quality installation safety standards and weather contingency planning

items.name: Dumpster Rental
items.dec: Rental and placement of a roll-off dumpster for efficient and lawful disposal of all roofing debris. This cost covers the duration of the project and transport to the waste disposal facility. This is separate from debris hauling labor.

items.name: Trip Fee
items.dec: Standard trip fee to cover the cost of transporting personnel, tools, and equipment to and from the job site located at 4803 Carriagepark Road, Fairfax, VA 22032.

items.name: Final Cleanup & Safety Sweep
items.dec: Complete site cleanup including magnetic nail sweep gutter cleaning and final safety inspection
